dialogue.question1: 1. How do you feel on our first deployment? Doesn't it feel a little weird not to have seen the sun for so long?
dialogue.question2: 2. What's it like being a machinist's mate?
dialogue.question3: 3. Where are you at with your quals?

responses.1:
I mean, I'll be excited to see it when we get to Japan, of course. But it's just as cool down here!
How many people get to see the inside of a nuclear sub
let alone work on one. How cool is that?
responses.2:
I mean, it's grimy work, sure. But the people we work with makes it all worth it.
Also, have you seen the way civilians look up to us?

 We're heroes!
responses.3:
Toughest part of being a sailor. Well, we showed up on the boat together, and I'd say I'm about halfway done.
Maybe another 2 months or so and I'll have them done.

intros: Just 2 more months to go before we port... I can't wait to see Okinawa.

dialogue.question1: 1. You look pretty awake, considering you’ve been working on the reactor for the last 8 hours or so.
dialogue.question2: 2. Is working as a nuke as hard as they say?
dialogue.question3: 3. How much longer do you have on your contract?

responses.1: I'm excited, man. We're supposed to port in Japan in a month. Okinawa is supposed to be beautiful. Long beaches, great seafood… If Chad's as happy as he is living down here, I can't imagine how giddy he's going to be when he's throwing back a cocktail on the Japanese coast.
responses.2: Meh. The training was really hard. Stressed guys out like crazy. But now? It's tough at times, but more than anything it's actually really interesting. It's crazy how we're running on pure nuclear energy, we manage to do so cleanly, and I get to help make that work.
responses.3: I don't know that it matters. I'm planning on resigning anyway.

intros: Man these contracts are really something...
Harvard better be ready for me when I get out of here, man.

Hey, man, I don't want to be here either but....
you look like you'd rather be ANYWHERE else.

dialogue.question2: 2. What are you going to do when you get out?
dialogue.question3: 3. How much longer do you have on your contract?

responses.1:
Honestly? They suck. We have no free time, no time to sleep...
But hey, I guess it's better than boot camp was.
responses.2:
Only what I've told you a thousand times, man.
I'm going to college, getting a real job.
Something that pays better and treats you like an actual human being, you know what I'm saying?
responses.3:
3 years. 3 years and then life REALLY begins.
Just hope I manage to stay sane until then...

Same goes for you
<Alan looks at you strangely>
